subject: Climate & Environment
title: Ground-Level Ozone
description: A quick win: understand Ground-Level Ozone.

hook.text: Ozone high in the sky protects us. Ozone at ground level slowly poisons us.

buildup.text: Car exhaust and factory fumes react with sunlight to create ozone at street level.

discovery.text: Ground-level ozone irritates lungs, worsens asthma, and damages crops worth billions.

twist.text: It peaks on hot, sunny, still days â€” exactly when people want to be outdoors.

climax.text: Children and outdoor workers are most at risk because they breathe more air per body weight.

punchline.text: The same molecule that shields us in the sky harms us on the ground.

quiz.question: How is ground-level ozone formed?
